resources.string: Please ensure that only the blood pressure values are seen and exclude all headers when cropping.
To use the OCR functionality, you need to allow access to your camera, gallery and external storage.
The image cannot be processed due to an error.\n\nContact IT support with the following error code if issue persists: %1$s
We couldn\\\'t find any handwriting or text to process.\n\nTip: Ensure the image is clear and cropped to only the values, and exclude any headers (such as \'Systolic\' and \'Diastolic\').
No records detected. Rescan or manually insert them by adding a new row.
Would you like to rescan for more records?
The app wasn\\\'t able to save the current record.\n\nIf the issue persists, contact IT support with the following error code: %1$s
Do you want to rescan the current records?\n\n(note: your previously scanned records will be saved)
Do you want to discard all progress and start over?
Field must only contain whole number.
Do you want to rescan the current records to achieve a better accuracy?\n\n(note: your previously scanned records will be saved)
Do you want to remove the selected row?
Something went wrong in getting the patient information. \n\nIf the issue persists, contact IT support with the following error code: %1$s
Please correct all errors before proceeding.
To select another photo, tap on the current photo to open your gallery.
Please upload patient\\\'s photo before continuing.
Please wait while the patient is being registered.
Would you like to search the patient instead?
Your BP is currently under control. Keep up the good work!
Your BP is seeing an increase. Consider some of the recommendations to lower your BP.
- Adhere to medications assigned by doctor, if any.\n

- Try a healthier diet with more vegetables. 
 - Lower sodium intake (< 1.5g / day). 
 - Limit caffeine usage.

- Manage your stress levels 
 - Increase your physical activities (2.5 - 5 hours / week) 
 - Maintain a healthy weight (BMI < 22.9) 
 - Stop smoking and/or drinking 
 - Need sufficient sleep (<7 hours / night)
Ensure patient\\\'s information is entered correctly. Otherwise, kindly confirm if this is the patient\\\'s first visit and proceed to register their information.
The app is having trouble communicating with the Firestore Database.\n\nIf the issue persists, contact IT support with the following error code: %1$s
You are not connected to the internet. Many app functions depend on internet connections, and your progress may not be saved. \n\nIf the issue persists, contact IT helpdesk for further assistance.

The credentials associated with the Staff ID or password you have provided do not match our records.\n\n(Note: If you have forgotten your login credentials, please contact IT helpdesk for further assistance.)
The associated Patient ID is not within the current session.\n\nPlease contact IT helpdesk for further assistance.
The associated Patient History could not be displayed.\n\nIf the issue persists, contact IT support with the following error code: %1$s
Patient information could not be found in current session. Please try again.

ENHANCe is a digital clinical decision support tool for capturing high blood pressure records from paper and digital diary and supports primary care physiciansâ€™ clinical decision-making when managing patients on home blood pressure monitoring.

The tool incorporates optical character recognition technology to recognise most handwritten blood pressure values, and automatically calculates the average blood pressure. This replaces the laborious process of reading and calculating blood pressure manually, ultimately reducing workload and human error.
Enter the code sent to your registered number via SMS.
This is the Privacy Statement activity.
The following are the recommendations based on the scanned BP records:
Tap on the file upload icon to select a photo from your gallery.
This is the Terms of Use activity.

Register a new patient along with their profile picture, NRIC number, legal name, gender, date of birth, address, height, and weight.\n\nFor registered patients, simply search for them using his/her NRIC and legal name.

Scan blood pressure (BP) records using the device camera, or select an image from gallery.

Thereafter, you can choose to either retake/reselect the image.

IMPORTANT: To ensure accurate handwriting/text recognition for the next part, you MUST crop the image such that only the blood pressure values are seen (EXCLUDE any headers).

Checks by the algorithm confirms for the presence of more than 12 records. Otherwise, it will prompt you to either scan again or proceed with the analysis.\n\nThe algorithm will also prompt you to rescan the current record should it exceed six errors the system.

You will be alerted of any BP values which are deemed to be abnormal/incorrect by the algorithm (reasons provided).

You are also required to enter the home BP target and clinic BP target.

You can also edit the BP values should you find any errors.

Simply press on the red circular minus icon to remove that respective row, or add a new row by pressing on the 'Add New Row' button.

NOTE: Should you decide to scan the current records again, your current progress EXCEPT your previous progress will be deleted.
Once all the blood pressure values have been checked, click on calculate average to continue.
You can view the previously recorded average blood pressure values, home BP target and clinic BP target of the selected patient.

Q. How to access the scan record page?

ANS: You need to search for the patient before you can select the 'Scan Record' at the bottom navigation bar.

Q. What part of the image should one keep for maximum handwriting/text detection accuracy?

ANS: Align your camera such that is fills up the top and bottom of the screen. Try to only crop the image HORIZONTALLY and leave only the systolic and diastolic BP values in the cropped image (EXCLUDE the header; only numbers).

Disclaimer: The scanner is not perfect and may yield erroneous results at times. The onus is on you to ensure the accuracy of these results before calculating the average blood pressure for this patient.
